Saya menyadari dan memahami sepenuhnya bahwa hasil perhitungan dan/atau simulasi yang ditampilkan di Welma Goals hanya dimaksudkan sebagai ilustrasi dan bukan merupakan jaminan hasil yang akan diperoleh. Saya bertanggung jawab sepenuhnya atas pilihan untuk menggunakan hasil perhitungan dan/atau simulasi yang dihasilkan dari Welma Goals. Tidak ada jaminan bahwa hasil perhitungan dan/atau simulasi Welma Goals akan akurat atau sesuai dengan kinerja di masa mendatang.

Saya menyadari dan memahami sepenuhnya bahwa simulasi tingkat pengembalian yang ditampilkan di Welma Goals mungkin tidak mencerminkan kinerja masa depan yang sebenarnya. Data ekonomi pada Welma Goals termasuk asumsi inflasi, pertumbuhan investasi, dan data statistik bersumber dari data internal BCA dan data dari pihak ketiga. Data tersebut dapat diperbarui secara berkala, dan dapat menyebabkan hasil yang berbeda antara sebelum dan sesudah pembaruan terjadi. Tidak ada jaminan keakuratan data ekonomi dan hasil perhitungan atau simulasi yang dicantumkan pada Welma Goals.

Saya menyadari dan memahami sepenuhnya bahwa alokasi kelas aset disusun berdasarkan hasil analisis internal BCA, dan dapat berubah sewaktu-waktu tanpa pemberitahuan terlebih dahulu apabila terdapat perubahan hasil analisis dan kebijakan internal BCA maupun faktor perubahan lainnya, sehingga dapat menyebabkan hasil yang berbeda antara sebelum dan sesudah perubahan terjadi. Oleh karena itu, Saya menyadari dan memahami sepenuhnya bahwa BCA tidak menjamin akurasi atas alokasi aset maupun pencapaian imbal hasil tertentu atau proteksi atas kerugian yang mungkin timbul dari investasi yang dilakukan dengan mengikuti alokasi aset tersebut.

Saya menyadari dan memahami sepenuhnya bahwa pembelian/pembelian berkala dan penjualan Unit Penyertaan Reksa Dana melalui Welma Goals dapat terdiri dari gabungan beberapa Reksa Dana dan transaksi pembelian/pembelian berkala maupun penjualan Unit Penyertaan Reksa Dana ditentukan berdasarkan hasil perhitungan menggunakan algoritma yang akan menentukan alokasi setiap Reksa Dana sesuai strategi yang telah dipilih.

Dalam hal memilih strategi yang tidak sesuai dengan profil risiko, Saya menyatakan setiap pembelian/pembelian berkala dan penjualan Unit Penyertaan Reksa Dana yang tidak sesuai dengan profil risiko merupakan keputusan Saya sepenuhnya. Saya telah memahami sepenuhnya segala risiko terkait dengan pembelian/pembelian berkala dan penjualan produk Unit Penyertaan Reksa Dana, dan Saya bertanggung jawab sepenuhnya atas segala akibat, risiko, dan kerugian yang timbul dari pembelian/pembelian berkala dan penjualan Unit Penyertaan Reksa Dana yang tidak sesuai dengan profil risiko saya serta membebaskan BCA dari segala tuntutan, gugatan, dan/atau tindakan hukum lainnya dari pihak mana pun dalam bentuk apa pun sehubungan dengan hal tersebut.

I agree that any dispute or difference of opinion arising from and/or in connection with the implementation of these Terms and Conditions for the Subscription, Redemption, and Switching of Mutual Fund Participation Units shall be amicably resolved through deliberation.

Any dispute or difference of opinion that cannot be amicably resolved through deliberation between BCA and me shall be resolved through banking mediation facilitated by Bank Indonesia or the Financial Services Authority or mediation through an Alternative Dispute Resolution Institution listed in the List of Alternative Dispute Resolution Institutions established by the Financial Services Authority.

"Any dispute or difference of opinion that cannot be amicably through deliberation, banking mediation, and/or the mediation as referred to in point 2 above, shall be resolved through the Central Jakarta District Court, without prejudice to BCA's right to file lawsuits or demands through any other District Courts within the territory of the Republic of Indonesia."

Government Bonds (SBN) is a capital market product which the payment of principal (nominal value) and interest/coupon/return is guaranteed by the laws and regulations governing the issuance of SBN. SBN is neither a product of BCA nor a third party deposits at BCA, therefore it is not insured by BCA and not included as the object covered by the government insurance program or the deposit insurance program. BCA is not responsible for any risks arising from investment in SBN.

For Retail SBN products that can be traded in the Secondary Market, there are potential investment risks including (i) losses (capital loss) that can occur if investor sells Retail SBN in the Secondary Market before maturity at a lower selling price than the purchase price (market risk) and (ii) liquidity risk if investors want to sell Retail SBN before the completion of the minimum holding period determined by the Government in the information memorandum or if Retail SBN cannot be sold at a reasonable price.

For Retail SBN products that cannot be traded on the Secondary Market, there are potential investment risks including liquidity risk if investors want to redeem Retail SBN outside the early redemption period determined by the Government in the information memorandum.
Any investment decision on SBN is the sole responsibility of the Investor.

Any fees incurred for the sale of Securities will be debited directly from the fund account that you designate for the purpose of selling Securities through myBCA according to the provisions applicable at BCA.

The proceeds from the sale of Securities will be credited to the fund account you designate for the crediting of the proceeds from the sale of Securities on myBCA. If you have not paid the Securities safekeeping fee at the time of the sale transaction, you hereby authorize BCA to debit your fund account for the purpose of paying the Securities safekeeping fee.
Under certain considerations, BCA has the right to reject or suspend the sale of Securities, including without limitation, upon the occurrence of any one or more of the following circumstances:
the stock exchange where the Securities are traded is closed;
the trading of the Securities is suspended by the stock exchange authority or any other competent authority;

there occurs a state of emergency as referred to in Law Number 8 of 1995 on Capital Markets, namely a situation beyond the control of any of the parties as a result of, among other things, war (including political and military turmoil), natural calamities such as earthquakes or floods, strikes, sabotage, or riots (including social turmoil), a sudden and dramatic drop in most or all of the prices of Securities listed on the stock exchange (crash), or a failure in the trading system or in transaction settlement (including restrictions on money exchange, remittance, or expropriation by the government);
based on an order from a competent authority.

Without prejudice to any other provisions contained in the Terms and Conditions for the Purchase and/or Sale of Securities, Securities cannot be sold until, in BCA’s opinion or based on a determination of a competent authority, the circumstance(s) that caused the suspension has ended.

I hereby grant irrevocable power to BCA to BLOCK and/or DEBIT any funds in my fund account in the amount equal to the sum due or any other amount required by BCA to settle all the transactions made on myBCA including the purchase fee, sale fee, and Securities safekeeping fee (if any) at Kustodian BCA, and my other obligations to BCA related to the purchase and/or sale of Securities through myBCA.

BCA means PT Bank Central Asia Tbk.
The debiting and crediting of funds in relation to the subscription and redemption of Participation Units shall be done using the same account.

Confirmation letters and monthly reports on the Mutual Fund investment will be issued by the Custodian Bank and will be provided through the KSEI AKSes facility. All taxes arising in connection with the subscription/redemption/switching of Participation Units shall be at your expense as a Participation Unit Holder in accordance with the applicable law.

Any other matters that have not been regulated in the Terms and Conditions for the Subscription, Redemption, and Switching of Mutual Fund Participation Units shall be further regulated in the Prospectus.

A Mutual Fund is a capital market product and is not a product of BCA, and therefore it is not guaranteed by BCA and is not within the scope of the deposit insurance program by the Indonesia Deposit Insurance Corporation (LPS).
BCA is not responsible for any investment advice on Mutual Fund that may be given and the performance of Mutual Fund.
Mutual Fund Participation Units (\"Participation Units\") are issued and offered under a Mutual Fund Collective Investment Contract between the Investment Manager and the Custodian Bank.
BCA is not responsible for the correctness, completeness, and accuracy of the contents of the Mutual Fund Prospectus issued by the Investment Manager.
Dividends from investment in Mutual Fund products (if any) may be either reinvested or paid out in cash according to the terms of the relevant Mutual Fund product as contained in the Prospectus.

If there is a change of address or in other information relating to you as a Participation Unit Holder, you agree to notify BCA of the change of address or in other information either in writing or orally. All consequences arising from your failure to notify the change of address or information shall be your full responsibility as a Participation Unit Holder.
The subscription/redemption/switching of Participation Units must be carried out in accordance with the terms and conditions contained in the Prospectus and the provisions applicable at BCA.

Under certain considerations, BCA reserves the right to reject your application for the subscription, redemption, and switching of Participation Units or require you as a Participation Unit Holder to redeem the Participation Units, among other things, if the data you provided for the subscription/recurring subscription of Participation Units, redemption of Participation Units, or switching of Participation Units (either in writing or orally) are not correct.

Before subscribing for Participation Units, the prospective Participation Unit Holder must read and fully understand the contents of the relevant Mutual Fund Prospectus. Then, the prospective Participation Unit Holder shall provide BCA with an instruction for the subscription/recurring subscription of Participation Units either in writing or orally according to the provisions applicable at BCA as well as other required documents (if any).

If the complete instruction for the subscription/recurring subscription of Participation Units is received by BCA and good funds are available in your account as a Participation Unit Holder for the debiting purpose in relation to your subscription of Participation Units no later than 13:00 Western Indonesia Time (WIB) on a stock exchange day, then the price of one Participation Unit shall be equal to the Net Asset Value per Participation Unit as of the close of the relevant stock exchange day. If the instruction for the subscription/recurring subscription of Participation Units is received by BCA and/or the good funds for the subscription of Participation Units are only available in your account after 13:00 WIB, then the price of a Participation Unit shall be equal to the Net Asset Value per Participation Unit as of the close of the following stock exchange day.

Notwithstanding any of the foregoing to the contrary, the funds to pay for the recurring subscription of Participation Units must be available in your source account as a Participation Unit Holder no later than one stock exchange day (T-1) prior to the date on which the recurring subscription is processed (T). If on T-1, the funds are insufficient, the recurring subscription for the relevant period will not be processed. If recurring subscriptions fail for 3 (three) consecutive months for any reason, BCA may terminate your recurring subscription program. All the consequences arising from the termination of the recurring subscription program will be your full responsibility as a Participation Unit Holder.

If the date of the recurring subscription of Participation Units falls on a stock exchange holiday or the date of the recurring subscription that you choose as a Participation Unit Holder is not available in the relevant month (for example, the months of February, April, June, September, November, which do not have a 31st day), then the recurring subscription will be processed on the next stock exchange day.

BCA has the right to determine the maximum period for the recurring subscription program, and such maximum period will be notified by BCA to you as a Participation Unit Holder from time to time in any form and through any means according to the applicable law.

As a Participation Unit Holder, you may redeem either part or all of the Participation Units you own, by providing BCA with an instruction for the redemption of Participation Units either in writing or orally according to the provisions applicable at BCA, as well as other required documents (if any).

An instruction for the redemption of Participation Units received by BCA no later than 13:00 WIB on the stock exchange day will be processed based on the Net Asset Value per Participation Unit as of the close of the same stock exchange day. An instruction for the redemption of Participation Units received by BCA after 13:00 WIB will be processed based on the Net Asset Value per Participation Unit as of the close of the following stock exchange day.
BCA may suspend the redemption of Participation Units, if:
The Stock Exchange where most of the Mutual Fund investment portfolio is traded is closed;
The trading of most of the Mutual Fund investment portfolio is suspended by the Stock Exchange authority.

There occurs a state of emergency as referred to in Law Number 8 of 1995 on Capital Markets, namely a situation beyond the control of any of the parties as a result of, among other things, war (including political and military turmoil), natural calamities such as earthquakes or floods, strikes, sabotage, or riots (including social turmoil), a sudden and dramatic drop in most or all of the prices of Securities listed on the stock exchange (crash), or a failure in the trading system or in transaction settlement (including restrictions on money exchange, remittance, or expropriation by the government), in which case the Investment Manager is obliged to report the same to the Financial Services Authority (OJK);
Based on an order from a competent authority.

Without prejudice to any other provisions contained in the Terms and Conditions for the Subscription, Redemption, and Switching of Mutual Fund Participation Units, Participation Units cannot be redeemed until, in BCA’s opinion or based on a determination of a competent authority, the circumstance(s) that caused the suspension has ended.

The proceeds from the redemption of Participation Units will be subject to deduction for the redemption fee as specified in the Prospectus and will be directly credited to the account you designate. The payment will be made no later than 7 (seven) stock exchange days after the instruction for the Participation Unit redemption is approved by the Investment Manager and the Selling Agent. All the costs arising from the redemption of Participation Units will be at your expense as a Participation Unit Holder.

If there is any discrepancy in the calculation of the number of Participation Units or the amount of payment, the data on the number of Participation Units recorded at the Custodian Bank or the calculation of the payment amount by the Custodian Bank shall prevail, unless proven otherwise.

As a Participation Unit Holder, you may switch either part or all of the Participation Units you own, by providing BCA with an instruction for the switching of Participation Units either in writing or orally according to the provisions applicable at BCA, as well as other required documents (if any).

You can only switch the Participation Units of Mutual Fund products that have a switching feature and that are managed by the same Investment Manager, subject to the provisions contained in the Prospectus and the provisions applicable at BCA.

An instruction for the switching of Participation Units received by BCA no later than 13:00 WIB on the stock exchange day will be processed based on the Net Asset Value per Participation Unit as of the close of the same stock exchange day. An instruction for the switching of Participation Units received by BCA after 13:00 WIB will be processed based on the Net Asset Value per Participation Unit as of the close of the following stock exchange day.
1. BCA may suspend the switching of Participation Units if:
The Stock Exchange where most of the Mutual Fund investment portfolio is traded is closed;
The trading of most of the Mutual Fund investment portfolio is suspended by the Stock Exchange authority.

There occurs a state of emergency as referred to in Law Number 8 of 1995 on Capital Markets, namely a situation beyond the control of any of the parties as a result of, among other things, war (including political and military turmoil), natural calamities such as earthquakes or floods, strikes, sabotage, or riots (including social turmoil), a sudden and dramatic drop in most or all of the prices of Securities listed on the stock exchange (crash), or a failure in the trading system or in transaction settlement (including restrictions on money exchange, remittance, or expropriation by the government), in which case the Investment Manager is obliged to report the same to the Financial Services Authority (OJK);
Based on an order from a competent authority.

Without prejudice to any other provisions contained in the Terms and Conditions for the Subscription, Redemption, and Switching of Mutual Fund Participation Units, Participation Units cannot be switched until, in BCA’s opinion or based on a determination of a competent authority, the circumstance(s) that caused the suspension has ended.

The proceeds from the switching of Participation Units will be subject to deduction for the switching fee as specified in the Prospectus and the proceeds of the switching will be applied to subscribe for the Participation Units of the Mutual Fund that you choose as a Participation Unit Holder. The switching will be conducted by the Custodian Bank no later than 7 (seven) stock exchange days after the instruction for the Participation Unit Switching is approved by the Investment Manager and the Selling Agent. All the costs arising from the switching of Participation Units will be at your expense as a Participation Unit Holder.

If there is any discrepancy in the calculation of the number of Participation Units or the switching amount, the data on the number of Participation Units recorded at the Custodian Bank or the calculation of the switching amount by the Custodian Bank shall prevail, unless proven otherwise.
As a Participation Unit Holder, I acknowledge and fully understand that:

I fully understand and agree that if my identity as a Participation Unit Holder or a beneficial owner of Participation Units cannot be examined to the satisfaction of the Investment Manager or otherwise can be examined but the result raises the Investment Manager’s suspicions that I, as a Participation Unit Holder, may be involved in activities related to money laundering, the Investment Manager has the right to reject my request for the subscription of Participation Units and at the request of the Investment Manager, I, as a Participation Unit Holder, must redeem the Participation Units that I own. As a Participation Unit Holder, I shall indemnify the Investment Manager and BCA for all claims, losses, damage, costs and expenses (including but not limited to all losses and legal fees that may be incurred by the Investment Manager and BCA) arising therefrom or in connection therewith.

I fully understand that the Investment Manager is not responsible to me as a Participation Unit Holder or a beneficial owner of Participation Units for any losses, expenses, or liabilities that may arise in connection with the rejection of my subscription or redemption or switching of Participation Units, for which I am solely responsible as a Participation Unit Holder or a beneficial owner of Participation Units.

I, as a Participation Unit Holder, hereby authorize BCA to provide my data as a Participation Unit Holder to the Investment Manager, the Custodian Bank, and the provider of the Integrated Investment Management System (S-INVEST) for activities related to Mutual Fund, or to a competent agency if required by the applicable law or for purposes of supervision by such agency.
I, as a Participation Unit Holder, hereby guarantee that all the data or information that I have provided to BCA are true, accurate, and complete.

If there is a change in the data or information, including, among other things, information about taxation, that I have provided to BCA through any means, I will notify BCA of the change in the data or information no later than 30 (thirty) calendar days from the occurrence of the change or within another period as may be notified by BCA in any form and through any means in accordance with the applicable provisions.

I, as a Participation Unit Holder, agree that BCA has the right to terminate its relationship with me as a Participation Unit Holder if it can be proven later that I have provided incorrect, inaccurate, or incomplete data or information, or that I have not notified BCA of any change in such data or information about myself as a Participation Unit Holder within the period prescribed by BCA.

A Mutual Fund is a product of the Investment Manager and is NOT a product of PT Bank Central Asia Tbk (“BCA”). BCA only acts as a Mutual Fund Selling Agent. BCA is not responsible for all the risks and losses arising from the management of the Mutual Fund portfolio;
BCA is not responsible for the performance of a Mutual Fund or an Investment Manager;
BCA (including any of its subsidiaries, shareholders, or other related parties of BCA) assumes no obligation regarding a Mutual Fund and makes no guarantee of the Mutual Fund;

An investment in a Mutual Fund does NOT constitute part of third-party deposits at BCA and therefore is not guaranteed by BCA and is NOT WITHIN the scope of the deposit insurance program by the Indonesia Deposit Insurance Corporation (LPS);

Investment in a Mutual Fund carries investment risks including but not limited to the risk of losing all the invested capital and the risk that the investment value of a Mutual Fund may go up or down due to fluctuations in the Net Asset Value (NAV) according to market conditions and the quality of the Securities in the Mutual Fund portfolio;

Every selection of a Mutual Fund product constitutes my very own decision, which I have made independently. I am fully responsible for all the consequences that may arise in connection with the selection of a Mutual Fund product and investment that I have made;

All subscription/recurring subscription, redemption, and switching transactions in relation to the Participation Units in a Mutual Fund are subject to the approval of the Investment Manager and the Selling Agent, and the transaction price will be determined based on the Net Asset Value per Participation Unit in accordance with the applicable terms and conditions;
The past performance of a Mutual Fund does not represent an indication or guarantee of its future investment performance and returns.

I have filled in the Investor Risk Profile column on myBCA and understand the contents thereof and I am fully responsible for all the consequences that may arise in connection with the selected Mutual Fund product that I subscribe/redeem/switch as a Participation Unit Holder.

I, as a Participation Unit Holder, hereby state that I have read and understood the Prospectus, Fund Fact Sheet, Terms and Conditions for the Subscription, Redemption, and Switching of Mutual Fund Participation Units as well as other information regarding Mutual Fund including the risks, and that I agree to comply with the Terms and Conditions for the Subscription, Redemption, and Switching of Mutual Fund Participation Units.

I understand that BCA has the right to change the Terms and Conditions for the Subscription, Redemption, and Switching of Mutual Fund Participation Units, and the change will be notified by BCA in any form and through any means according to the applicable law.

My investment in the Mutual Fund Participation Units is based on the information contained in the Prospectus and Fund Fact Sheet of the relevant Mutual Fund provided by BCA as the Mutual Fund Selling Agent. There are no other forms of Mutual Fund offering documents provided and/or promised by BCA as the Mutual Fund Selling Agent to me. I understand that the Mutual Fund Prospectus and/or Fund Fact Sheet are the official offering documents of the Mutual Fund managed by the Investment Manager.

I hereby authorize BCA to debit my account as a Participation Unit Holder at BCA for the subscription/recurring subscription of Participation Units either in writing or orally through certain BCA Branch Offices that serve Mutual Fund transactions, applications, or other facilities provided by BCA as well as for any fees and costs incurred in relation to Mutual Fund transactions including but not limited to the subscription/recurring subscription, redemption, and/or switching fees, taxes (if any), and Stamp Duty on Mutual Fund Transaction Confirmation Letters in accordance with the applicable law.

I am fully aware that the proceeds from the redemption of Mutual Fund Participation Units will be paid and/or the switching of Mutual Fund Participation Units will be processed no later than 7 (seven) stock exchange days after the request for redemption and/or switching of Mutual Fund Participation Units is approved by the Investment Manager and the Selling Agent. I understand that the period specified above may be changed at any time according to the applicable provisions, and the change will be notified by BCA in any form and through any means according to the applicable law.
I hereby confirm and guarantee that I am not prohibited from subscribing for or holding Participation Units under the applicable law.

I undertake not to be involved in any activities related to money laundering or any actions that may cause an Investment Manager, a Custodian Bank, BCA, or a Mutual Fund to be involved or implicated in activities related to money laundering.

Emergency Fund is a fund that is prepared to anticipate unexpected situations in the future. For example, for sudden hospital payments, home or vehicle repairs if there is damage, or to cover living expenses if you are laid off.

The emergency fund needs of each individual and family may vary depending on their respective conditions. However, to provide an estimate of the funds needed, a calculator is available to help calculate your emergency fund needs, please click “Emergency Fund Calculator” on the Goal Information screen.

With the main function to anticipate unexpected conditions, emergency funds should be easily accessible and liquid / easy to withdraw. For this reason, Goal Emergency Fund consists of Money Market Mutual Fund products.

Investment Goals is a feature that helps you design an investment portfolio customized to your needs to achieve your investment goals.
Investment Goals will allocate Your investment to several asset classes, according to your risk profile or the strategy you choose to achieve your investment goals.

The technology of Investment Goals will provide information for adjusting the proportion of the investment portfolio if there are any changes in strategy, economic conditions, or other conditions that cause your investment proportion to be less than ideal.
Investment Goals will conduct real time and continuous monitoring, so you will immediately receive the latest information on the achievement of your investment goals.
